gr.aueb.databasics

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • gr.aueb.databasics.Database

  • public class Database
extends Object
    Database is the class that allows the creation and editing of databases. A Database object is practically a series of Table objects held inside an ArrayList of type Table and encapsulates the basic information needed for this purpose:
    • The database's name
    • The number of tables that the database holds
    • The Table objects which contain the content the user inputs

    The class is designed in such manner that it will support methods inside of it and other classes externally to execute the usual functions that a database has, such as:

    • Delete a database
    • Save a database
    • Import a table
    • Copy an entry to another position of the same or another table
    • Cut an entry to another position of the same or another table
    • Copy a single field to another position of the same or another table
    • Cut a single field to another position of the same or another table
    • More

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    George Bakalis, Andreas Vlachos, Evi Vratsanou

      • tempTable

        public void tempTable(String nameCopy,
                      int copyK,
                      String newName)
        This method copies a whole table to a new table that is created.
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the name of the table the user wants to copy.
        copyK - An int element which contains the position of the table to be copied in the arrayList that contains all tables in this specific database.
        newName - An String element, containing the name of the table that will be created.

      • copyTable

        public void copyTable(String nameCopy,
                      String namePaste)
        This method copies a table to an other, either this table exists or not, using the method tempTable of class Database in order to the copied elements of the table not to be affected by changes in the original table. If the table the user wants to paste the original table to does not exists, a new table is created, named by the name the user gave.
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the name of the table the user wants to copy.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table the user wants to paste the original table. If this table does not exist in the database, this is the name of the table which will be created.

      • position

        public int position(String tableName)
        Gives the position of a table
        Parameters:
        tableName - Contains the name of the table
        Returns:
        Returns the table's position in ArrayList<Table> tables

      • position

        public ArrayList<Integer> position(ArrayList<String> tableNames)
        Gives the positions of the specified tables inside a database
        Parameters:
        tableNames - Contains the names of the tables
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of integers corresponding to the tables' positions

      • copyExistingEntry

        public void copyExistingEntry(String nameCopy,
                              int entryNumCopy,
                              String namePaste,
                              int entryNumPaste)
        This method copies a whole entry of a table, specified by the user, replacing another entry of a table, specified by the user.
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table the user wants to copy.
        entryNumCopy - An int element, containing the number that indicates the position of the entry which will be copied.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table the user wants to paste.
        entryNumPaste - An int element, containing the number that indicates the position of the entry where the other entry will be pasted.

      • copyNewEntry

        public void copyNewEntry(String nameCopy,
                         int entryNumCopy,
                         String namePaste)
        This method creates a new entry of a table specified by the user by copying another entry of a table.
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table that contains the entry the user wants to copy.
        entryNumCopy - An int element, containing the position of the entry which will be copied
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table where the user wants to paste the entry.

      • copyNewAttribute

        public void copyNewAttribute(String nameCopy,
                             String attNameC,
                             String namePaste,
                             String attNameP)
        This method creates a new attribute in a table specified by the user, using the method findChoice by copying an other attribute of a table.
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table that contains the attribute the user wants to copy.
        attNameC - An String element containing the name of the attribute which will be copied.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table where the user wants to paste the attribute.
        attNameP - An String element, containing the name of the attribute which will be created.

      • copyExistingAttribute

        public void copyExistingAttribute(String nameCopy,
                                  String attNameC,
                                  String namePaste,
                                  String attNameP)
        This method copies an attribute of a table specified by the user to an other attribute of a table, only if they have the same type of elements.
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table that contains the attribute the user wants to copy.
        attNameC - An Stringelement, containing the name of the attribute which will be copied.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table where the user wants to paste the attribute.
        attNameP - An String element, containing the name of the attribute where the user wants to paste the original attribute.

      • findChoice

        public int findChoice(int copyK,
                      int attNumC)
        This method finds the number of the choice the user made when he created an attribute based on which is the type of the elements of this specific attribute.
        Parameters:
        copyK - An int element, containing the position of the table that contains the attribute.
        attNumC - An int element, containing the position of the attribute in the table.
        Returns:
        An int element, containing the number of the choice the user made when he created this attribute.

      • copyElement

        public void copyElement(String nameCopy,
                        String attNameC,
                        int lineC,
                        String namePaste,
                        String attNameP,
                        int lineP)
        This method copies an element of a table specified by the user to another element of a table specified by the user, only if they have the same type.
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table that contains the element the user wants to copy.
        attNameC - An String element, containing the name of the attribute that contains the element the user wants to copy.
        lineC - An int element, containing the position of the entry that contains the element the user wants to copy.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table where the user wants to paste the element.
        attNameP - An String element, containing the name of the attribute where the user wants to paste the element.
        lineP - An int element, containing the position of the entry where the user wants to paste the element.

      • cutExistingEntry

        public void cutExistingEntry(String nameCopy,
                             int entryNumCopy,
                             String namePaste,
                             int entryNumPaste)
        This method implements the function of cut - paste of an entry using the methods copyExistingEntry(String, int, String, int) and Table.deleteEntry(int)
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table the user wants to copy.
        entryNumCopy - An int element, containing the number that indicates the position of the entry which will be copied.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table the user wants to paste.
        entryNumPaste - An int element, containing the number that indicates the position of the entry where the other entry will be pasted.

      • cutNewEntry

        public void cutNewEntry(String nameCopy,
                        int entryNumCopy,
                        String namePaste)
        This method implements the function of cut an entry and creating a new one based on the first using the methods copyNewEntry(String, int, String) and Table.deleteEntry(int)
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table that contains the entry the user wants to cut.
        entryNumCopy - An int element, containing the position of the entry which will be cut.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table where the user wants to paste the entry.

      • cutExistingAttribute

        public void cutExistingAttribute(String nameCopy,
                                 String attNameC,
                                 String namePaste,
                                 String attNameP)
        This method implements the function cut-paste of an attribute using the methods copyExistingAttribute(String, String, String, String) and Table.deleteAttribute(String)
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table that contains the attribute the user wants to copy.
        attNameC - An String element, containing the name of the attribute which will be copied.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table where the user wants to paste the attribute.
        attNameP - An String element, containing the name of the attribute where the user wants to paste the original attribute.

      • cutNewAttribute

        public void cutNewAttribute(String nameCopy,
                            String attNameC,
                            String namePaste,
                            String attNameP)
        This method implements the function cut of an attribute kaicreates a new attribute based on the original attribute using the methods copyNewAttribute(String, String, String, String) and Table.deleteAttribute(String)
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table that contains the attribute the user wants to copy.
        attNameC - An String element, containing the name of the attribute which will be copied.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table where the user wants to paste the attribute.
        attNameP - An String element, containing the name of the attribute where the user wants to paste the original attribute.

      • cutElement

        public void cutElement(String nameCopy,
                       String attNameC,
                       int lineC,
                       String namePaste,
                       String attNameP,
                       int lineP)
        This method implements the function cut-paste of an element using the methods copyElement(String, String, int, String, String, int) and Table.deleteElement(int, String)
        Parameters:
        nameCopy - An String element, containing the name of the table that contains the element the user wants to copy.
        attNameC - An String element, containing the name of the attribute that contains the element the user wants to copy.
        lineC - An int element, containing the position of the entry that contains the element the user wants to copy.
        namePaste - An String element, containing the name of the table where the user wants to paste the element.
        attNameP - An String element, containing the name of the attribute where the user wants to paste the element.
        lineP - An int element, containing the position of the entry where the user wants to paste the element.

      • saveDatabase

        public void saveDatabase()
        This methods is used to save a database in the DatabaseUniverse Directory. Each database is saved as a directory with the name of the database, containing a csv file for each table of the database. If a database already existed, all table files are deleted, and new ones are created.

      • importTable

        public void importTable(BufferedReader br)
        This method imports a table from a csv file, the location of which is specified by the user. The format of the file must be as follows:
        • Line one: Name of the table
        • Line two: Types of the attributes separated by commas
        • Line three: Names of the attributes separated by commas
        • Each of the remaining lines: Values of each line, separated by commas
        The user is responsible for the contents of each line for no checks will be conducted concerning the matching of the attribute types and the element values.
        Parameters:
        br - A BufferedReader object used to read from the file.

      • convertTypes

        public static int[] convertTypes(String[] types)
        A method that matches the types of an attribute with a specific number so that a method can make use of the Table.newAttribute(String, int) method.
        Parameters:
        types - An array of String elements among "string", "char", "int", "double", "date" and any other type (to be matched with the object case), representing a type in a String format
        Returns:
        An array of int elements, each one representing a choice of type in compliance with the Table.newAttribute(String, int) method.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes the database object it's called onto.

      • listTables

        public void listTables()
        This method lists the names of the existing tables in a database.
